intro: Pinaropappus scapiger, commonly known as the scapigerous pappus plant, is a rare species native to specific regions of the Mediterranean. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing adaptations to withstand drought and poor soil conditions. Its flowers are usually small and yellow, arranged in clusters, and it produces feathery seeds that aid in wind dispersal. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
